title: Being a Farm and Ranch REALTOR: Dr. Charles Porter

tasks.task: Walk the land to understand its three-dimensional aspects in relation to farm and ranch operations.
subtasks: Navigate a 4,000-acre ranch during a specific season (e.g., August).
Assess the topography and features of the land through firsthand observation.

tasks.task: Understand the complexities of real estate in the farming and ranching industry.
subtasks: Recognize the importance of mineral rights, water rights, and various leases in farmland management.
Comprehend the transition of farm and ranch properties becoming a safe haven and high-return investment post-2007.
Appreciate the tax advantages associated with agricultural valuations, such as reduced tax obligations in certain counties.

tasks.task: Adhere to fiduciary duties and ethical standards in real estate brokerage involving farm and ranch properties.
subtasks: Prioritize clients' interests over personal interests when dealing with land purchases and agricultural investments.
Comply with the three instances of fiduciary duty mentioned in TREC rules (canons of ethics, 535.2, and 535.156).
